filmography.title: Smoky
filmography.role_description: A singing cowboy narrator who provides the musical backdrop to the story of a wild stallion.
filmography.plot: A cowboy captures and trains a wild horse, developing a deep bond with the animal.

filmography.title: Green Grass of Wyoming
filmography.role_description: The ranch hand uncle of the protagonist in this Technicolor equestrian drama.
filmography.plot: A young rancher tries to capture a white stallion and win the heart of a rival rancher's daughter.

filmography.title: Station West
filmography.role_description: A hotel clerk who serves as a Greek chorus, singing ballads that comment on the mystery.
filmography.plot: An army intelligence officer goes undercover to investigate a robbery and murder at a western outpost.

filmography.title: So Dear to My Heart
filmography.role_description: A kindly, singing blacksmith who encourages a young boy to raise a black sheep.
filmography.plot: A young farm boy in 1903 Indiana raises a black lamb rejected by its mother and dreams of showing it at the county fair.
filmography.awards: Oscar Nomination: Best Original Song ('Lavender Blue')

filmography.title: Sierra
filmography.role_description: A prospector who helps a young man hiding in the mountains with his fugitive father.
filmography.plot: A young man who has lived his whole life in the mountains to protect his father runs into a lost woman.

filmography.title: East of Eden
filmography.role_description: The understanding town sheriff who keeps a watchful eye on the troubled protagonist, Cal Trask.
filmography.plot: A wilful young man contends against his brother for the attention of their religious father while reconnecting with his estranged mother.

filmography.title: The Power and the Prize
filmography.role_description: A ruthless business executive who clashes with a younger associate over ethics and romance.
filmography.plot: An ambitious executive falls in love with a refugee, threatening a major international merger orchestrated by his boss.

filmography.title: Desire Under the Elms
filmography.role_description: The tyrannical 70-year-old patriarch who marries a young woman, sparking a family tragedy.
filmography.plot: A farmer's new young wife falls in love with his son, leading to a tragic conflict over land and legacy.

filmography.title: The Big Country
filmography.role_description: The fierce patriarch of a rough clan engaged in a bitter feud over water rights; the role earned him an Academy Award.
filmography.plot: A New Englander arrives in the Old West, where he becomes embroiled in a feud between two families over a valuable patch of land.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
filmography.role_description: The domineering, wealthy plantation owner confronting his mortality and his family's deceit.
filmography.plot: Brick, an alcoholic ex-football player, drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife. A reunion with his terminal father jogs a host of revelations.

filmography.title: Wind Across the Everglades
filmography.role_description: The leader of a gang of bird poachers in the Florida Everglades who respects a game warden's courage.
filmography.plot: A game warden arrives in the Florida Everglades to enforce conservation laws against a fierce group of bird poachers.

filmography.title: Day of the Outlaw
filmography.role_description: A wounded, dying outlaw captain who tries to control his violent gang while holding a town hostage.
filmography.plot: A rancher and his rival must put aside their differences when a gang of outlaws takes over their snowbound town.

filmography.title: Our Man in Havana
filmography.role_description: An old German doctor living in Cuba who becomes a tragic figure in a spy farce.
filmography.plot: An expatriate Englishman living in Havana creates a ring of fictional spies to satisfy his British intelligence superiors.

filmography.title: Let No Man Write My Epitaph
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic, disgraced former judge who tries to protect a young man from the slums.
filmography.plot: The son of an executed criminal tries to escape his impoverished, crime-ridden neighborhood with the help of his mother and friends.

filmography.title: The Spiral Road
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, atheist doctor specializing in leprosy who mentors a young, arrogant physician in the jungle.
filmography.plot: A doctor travels to the Dutch East Indies to study leprosy and undergoes a crisis of faith.

filmography.title: Summer Magic
filmography.role_description: A kindly, singing shopkeeper who helps a widow and her children settle into a new home.
filmography.plot: A widow and her children move to a small town in Maine, where they are aided by a friendly postmaster.

filmography.title: The Brass Bottle
filmography.role_description: An ancient genie released from a bottle who causes comedic chaos for his modern-day master.
filmography.plot: An architect buys an antique brass bottle and accidentally releases a genie who tries to help him but only causes trouble.

filmography.title: Ensign Pulver
filmography.role_description: The tyrannical captain of a cargo ship who is the antagonist to the scheming Ensign Pulver.
filmography.plot: A sequel to 'Mister Roberts', following the adventures of the ship's lazy morale officer as he clashes with the captain.

filmography.title: Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
filmography.role_description: The narrator and singer of the Christmas classic, performing 'A Holly Jolly Christmas' and 'Silver and Gold'.
filmography.plot: A young reindeer with a glowing red nose and an elf who wants to be a dentist look for acceptance.

filmography.title: Blast-Off
filmography.role_description: The legendary showman who finances a Victorian-era expedition to the moon in this sci-fi comedy.
filmography.plot: P.T. Barnum and other adventurers attempt to launch a rocket to the moon in Victorian England.
filmography.awards: Also known as 'Those Fantastic Flying Fools'

filmography.title: The McMasters
filmography.role_description: A benevolent rancher who gives a Native American man a stake in his land, sparking racial tension.
filmography.plot: A black Union soldier returns to the South after the Civil War and faces hostility when he is given a share of a ranch.

filmography.title: Baker's Hawk
filmography.role_description: A recluse who befriends a young boy and helps him train a hawk, teaching him about nature and responsibility.
filmography.plot: A young boy befriends a mountain man who helps him heal an injured hawk, learning lessons about life along the way.

filmography.title: Just You and Me, Kid
filmography.role_description: An elderly ex-vaudevillian who befriends a runaway teenager (Brooke Shields), leading to comic misadventures.
filmography.plot: A retired vaudeville performer takes in a young runaway, causing trouble with the neighbors and the police.

filmography.title: White Dog
filmography.role_description: An animal trainer who runs a sanctuary and warns against the dangers of retraining a 'white dog' programmed to attack Black people.
filmography.plot: A trainer attempts to deprogram a dog trained to attack black people, while the dog's owner struggles with the morality of the situation.

filmography.title: Two Moon Junction
filmography.role_description: The local sheriff in this erotic drama, marking Ives' final appearance in a theatrical film.
filmography.plot: A Southern debutante abandons her groom at the altar for a carnival worker.
